required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Osimertinib Plus Chemotherapy vs Osimertinib in EGFRm NSCLC With Persistence Week-3 ctDNA EGFRm After 1L Osimertinib
clinical_study.official_title: The Efficacy and Safety of Osimertinib Plus Carboplatin and Pemetrexed Versus Osimertinib Monotherapy in Metastatic EGFRm NSCLC Patients With EGFRm Persistence in ctDNA at 3 Weeks After 1L Osimertinib: A Multicenter, Randomized Controlled Study

collaborator.agency: Cancer Institute and Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, randomised, open-label, positive-controlled study to investigate the efficacy and safety of Osimertinib plus Carboplatin/Pemetrexed versus Osimertinib monotherapy in metastatic EGFRm NSCLC patients with EGFRm persistence in ctDNA at 3 weeks after first-line therapy with Osimertinib.

primary_outcome.time_frame: The primary analysis of Progression-free survival (PFS) based on investigator assessment will occur when PFS maturity is observed at approximately 30 months after the first patient is randomized.
primary_outcome.description: Progression-free survival (PFS) using Investigator assessment as defined by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors version 1.1 (RECIST 1.1).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The OS rate at 18 months will be defined as the Kaplan-Meier estimate of OS at 18 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients alive at 18 months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Objective Response Rate analysis will occur when Progression-free survival (PFS) maturity is observed at approximately 30 months from the first patient being randomized.
secondary_outcome.description: ORR (per RECIST 1.1 using Investigator assessments) is defined as the number (percent) of patients with at least 1 visit response of CR or PR.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Disease control rate analysis will occur when Progression-free survival (PFS) maturity is observed at approximately 30 months from the first patient being randomized.
secondary_outcome.description: Disease control rate (DCR) is defined as the percentage of subjects who have a best overall response of CR or PR or SD by RECIST 1.1 as assessed by the Investigator.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Duration of Response analysis will occur when Progression-free survival (PFS) maturity is observed at approximately 30 months from the first patient being randomized.
secondary_outcome.description: DoR is defined as the time from the date of first documented response until the date of documented progression or death in the absence of disease progression.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Depth of Response analysis will occur when Progression-free survival (PFS) maturity is observed at approximately 30 months from the first patient being randomized.
secondary_outcome.description: Depth of response by Investigator is defined as the relative change in the sum of the longest diameters of RECIST target lesions at the nadir in the absence of NLs or progression of NTLs when compared to baseline.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Safety and tolerability analysis will occur when Progression-free survival (PFS) maturity is observed at approximately 30 months from the first patient being randomized.
secondary_outcome.description: All Adverse events/â‰¥grade 3 AE/SAE incidence rate (AE/SAE graded by CTCAE v5); All ADR incidence rate; AESI: ILD/pneumonitis-like event, Cardiac failure

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Molecular resistance mechanism analysis will occur when Progression-free survival (PFS) maturity is observed at approximately 30 months from the first patient being randomized.
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate potential molecular resistance mechanism by biomarker analysis of plasma at baseline and disease progression and tissue samples (if applicable) by next-generation sequencing (NGS).

arm_group.arm_group_label: Osimertinib 80 mg QD and platinum-based chemotherapy
arm_group.description: Osimertinib 80 mg in combination with pemetrexed (500 mg/m2) plus carboplatin (AUC5) on Day 1 of 21day cycles (every 3 weeks) for up to 6 cycles, followed by Osimertinib daily with pemetrexed maintenance (500 mg/m2) every 3 weeks.
All patients randomized into this will only receive Osimertinib 80mg.

intervention.description: Pemetrexed (500 mg/m2) plus carboplatin (AUC5) on Day 1 of 21day cycles (every 3 weeks) for up to 6 cycles, followed by Osimertinib daily with pemetrexed maintenance (500 mg/m2) every 3 weeks.
intervention.arm_group_label: Osimertinib 80 mg QD and platinum-based chemotherapy

intervention.description: Pemetrexed (500 mg/m2) plus carboplatin (AUC5) on Day 1 of 21day cycles (every 3 weeks) for up to 6 cycles, followed by Osimertinib daily with pemetrexed maintenance (500 mg/m2) every 3 weeks.
intervention.arm_group_label: Osimertinib 80 mg QD and platinum-based chemotherapy
